title.native: ひめチェン! おとぎちっくアイドル リルぷりっ
title.romaji: Hime Chen! Otogi Chikku Idol Lilpri

description: The Fairytale World is in trouble. Its princesses and their respective worlds are disappearing, causing a ripple effect in the human world where their stories are popular. In order to save the Fairytale World, the Queen sends three magic animals, Sei, Dai, and Ryoku, to the human world with magic gems to find three girls who can become the "Super Miracle Idols," the princesses Snow White, Cinderella, and Kaguya-hime. Those "princesses" end up being three little girls: Yukimori Ringo, Takashiro Layla, and Sasahara Natsuki. But the gems transform them into older singing superstars, and after their accidental debut at the singer Wish's concert, they become known as "Little Princesses," or "LilPri." Now they must collect Happiness Tones from humans in order to restore the Fairytale World.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

node.description: Lilpri is a Hello! Project unit formed to promote and sing songs for the anime "Hime-chen! Otogichikku Idol Lilpri". The three members of the group provide the voices for the main characters in the show.  The group is made of three of the members from the Hello! Project group S/mileage.  Name: Wada Ayaka Character: Yukimori Ringo  Name: Maeda Yuuka Character: Takashiru Layla  Name: Fukuda Kanon Character: Sasahara Natsuki

[Website](http://helloproject.com/angerme/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/angerme) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/angerme_upfront) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/angerme_official/) Member Blog: [2nd Gen](https://ameblo.jp/angerme-amerika) | [3rd-6th Gen](https://ameblo.jp/angerme-ss-shin) | [7th-8th Gen](https://ameblo.jp/angerme-new) On April 4, 2009, Tsunku announced on his blog that a new group consisting of Hello! Pro Egg members would be formed. He later revealed that the members would be [Ayaka Wada](https://anilist.co/staff/105078), [Yuuka Maeda](https://anilist.co/staff/105080) and [Kanon Fukuda](https://anilist.co/staff/105079), all formerly of [Shugo Chara Egg!](https://anilist.co/staff/102226/Shugo-Chara-Egg), as well as fellow Egg Saki Ogawa, and announced that Ayaka would be the leader. A month later, on May 7, 2009, he revealed the group's name to be "__S/mileage__" ( スマイレージ); the name is a portmanteau of the English words "smile", "mileage", and "age", and together the name means "the age of smiles". The group was renamed to __ANGERME__ (アンジュルム) on December 17, 2014. Current Members: - Akari Takeuchi (竹内朱莉) - Born November 23, 1997 - From Saitama Prefecture - Joined August 14, 2011 - Leader since June 19, 2019 - Ayano Kawamura (川村文乃) - Born July 7, 1999 - From Kochi Prefecture - Joined June 26, 2017 - Subleader since June 19, 2019 - Rikako Sasaki (佐々木莉佳子) - Born May 28, 2001 - From Miyagi Prefecture - Joined October 4, 2014 - Moe Kamikokuryou (上國料萌衣) - Born October 24, 1999 - From Kumamoto Prefecture - Joined November 11, 2015 - Layla Ise (伊勢鈴蘭) - Born January 19, 2004 - From Hokkaido Prefecture - Joined November 23, 2018 - Rin Hashisako (橋迫鈴) - Born October 6, 2005 - From Aichi Prefecture - Joined July 3, 2019 - Rin Kawana (川名凛) - Born December 6, 2003 - From Chiba Prefecture - Joined November 2, 2020 - Shion Tamenaga (為永幸音) - Born February 9, 2004 - From Nagano Prefecture - Joined November 2, 2020 - Wakana Matsumoto (松本わかな) - Born September 1, 2007 - From Kanagawa Prefecture - Joined November 2, 2020 Former Members - [Ayaka Wada](https://anilist.co/staff/105078) (和田彩花) - former leader, graduated June 2019 - [Yuuka Maeda](https://anilist.co/staff/105080) (前田憂佳) - graduated December 2011 - [Kanon Fukuda](https://anilist.co/staff/105079) (福田花音) - graduated November 2015 - Saki Ogawa (小川紗季) - graduated August 2011 - Kana Nakanishi (中西香菜) - graduated December 2019 - Fuyuka Kosuga (小数賀芙由香) - submember, left September 2011 - Rina Katsuta (勝田里奈) - graduated September 2019 - Meimi Tamura (田村芽実) - graduated May 2016 - Mizuki Murota (室田瑞希) - graduated March 2020 - Maho Aikawa (相川茉穂) - graduated December 2017 - Momona Kasahara (笠原桃奈) - graduated November 2021 - Musubu Funaki (船木結) - graduated December 2020 - Haruka Oota (太田遥香) - left October 2020

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/iyaiyaenn/)

She started working as animator for [Shin-Ei Douga](https://anilist.co/studio/247/ShinEi-Animation), where she later debuted as assistant episode director on [Yakyuukyou no Uta](https://anilist.co/anime/10554//) and [Ikkyuu-san](https://anilist.co/anime/4935/) before she became storyboarder and then episode director on the [Doraemon](https://anilist.co/anime/2471/Doraemon-1979/) television series. In 1982, when another former Shin-ei director, [Fukutomi Hiroshi](https://anilist.co/staff/105280/Hiroshi-Fukutomi), established [Animaru-Ya](https://anilist.co/studio/386/Animaruya) she was one of the founding members together with Sanada Yoshinobu and [Honda Toshiyuki](https://anilist.co/staff/129528/Toshiyuki--Honda). She stayed at Animaru-Ya, which is presently known as [Ekura Animaru](https://anilist.co/studio/6257/Ekura-Animal), until 2004 before leaving to work as freelancer.

(Source: aniDB)
He was originally part of Studio Live, but in 1995 switched over to Studio Fantasia.

__[Website](http://www.naotyu-studio7.com/)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/chiba0413)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/naotyu_ch)__

__Birthplace:__ Sapporo, Hokkaido Prefecture, Japan

__Naoki Chiba__, also known as naotyu- is a Japanese composer, arranger, lyricist and producer. He is affiliated with Sony Music Publishing.

The three members of the group provide the voices for the main characters in the show.  The group is made of three of the members from the Hello! Project group S/mileage.  Name: Wada Ayaka Character: Yukimori Ringo  Name: Maeda Yuuka Character: Takashiru Layla  Name: Fukuda Kanon Character: Sasahara Natsuki

__[Website](http://www.tsunku.net/)__

__Birthplace:__ Higashiosaka City, Osaka Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Kinki University (Faculty of Commerce)

__Introduction:__
Mitsuo Terada, alternatively known by stage name Tsunku, is a prolific Japanese record producer, songwriter, and vocalist.

__Biography:__
He is best known for having two major roles in the Japanese music landscape: first as the lead singer of the popular rock group Sharam Q, and now as the producer, primary composer, lyricist, and (until 2014) primary studio backing vocalist for highly popular idol group [Morning Musume](https://anilist.co/staff/150336/), in addition to Aya Matsuura and other associated idols under the Hello! Project banner, for whom he has written and produced the vast majority of their chart-topping hits. 

(Source: [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tsunku))

__[Website](http://www.tsunku.net/)__

__Birthplace:__ Higashiosaka City, Osaka Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Kinki University (Faculty of Commerce)

Project banner, for whom he has written and produced the vast majority of their chart-topping hits.

[Website](http://itagakiyusuke.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/gakky_gakky)

Yuusuke Itagaki is a composer and arranger.

Introduction Name: Keiichi Wakui Place of Birth: Nagano Height: 177cm Keiichi Wakui is a music arranger, composer and DJ, under the label Snow White Music Co. Ltd. Biography During his first year of junior high school, Wakui Keiichi had a sudden urge to play the guitar. In his earnest he gathered his remaining pocket money to try and buy a guitar, but as it turned out he didn't have enough. As his passion grew he instead immersed himself in drums, which carried over to a band role. He devoted most of his youth in bands, 6 or so specifically, which he himself grew in along with others. In later years through the fate of twists and turns, and various changes, he ended up converting to a 'Producer'. His focus as a producer was resonant with the Rock & Pop genres, hence his involvement with artists of said genres. Wakui has had a lot of project involvement as producer, or sound producer, which have helped people improve enough to even perform at the Budokan (Source: snowwhitemusic.com)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/325492584) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=tatsuya_yoshihara)

Freelance animator formerly affiliated with [Actas](https://anilist.co/studio/60/) where he was attending its internal animation school and debuted as animator at the age of 20. His work has been greatly influenced by contemporary Kanada school animators [Seiya Numata](https://anilist.co/staff/124320/) and [Hironori Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/103979/). 

He's a precocious talent, debuting as episode director at the age of 21 and as director at the age of 23 with [Arve Rezzle](https://anilist.co/anime/13863/), as part of the Young Animator Training Project.

Married to fellow animator [Kikuko Sadakata](https://anilist.co/staff/105769).
